ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Line and level of reinstated bluestone kerbing shall be set out according to design levels. Line and level of tactiles shall be set out according to design levels to suit new kerb height (if applicable).

Construction of Access Ramp Bluestone Footpath
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: RhinoTac Accessible Tactile should be cut and dry laid in accordance with the site specific application and applicable standards before fixing
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure the placement of the tiles are in accordance with IFC drawings and are compliant to AS1428.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Apply adhesive mateial to the back of the RhinoTac Accessible Tactile, around the periphery and through the middle, be sure to apply enough adhesive to bind the tile to the substrate.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Carefully place the RhinoTac Accessible Tactile and apply pressure to transfer the adhesive. Drill down approximately 30mm into the subtrate using a hammer drill to fasten 6mm diameter screw
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Excess adhesive must be removed immeediately from the surface before curing, using a clean damp cloth (water only).
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure pavement area is free of debris and waste.
